title: [Fix](regression) Fix `test_partial_update_schema_change`
body:
## Proposed changes
When the regression test `test_partial_update_schema_change` try to wait for the current schema change to finish. It use `SHOW ALTER TABLE COLUMN WHERE TableName = '${tableName}' ORDER BY CreateTime DESC LIMIT 1;` to get the status of the current schema change job. Although the field `CreateTime` has precision up to millisecond, before sorting the results, it will first serialize the fields to string and the default string presentation of `CreateTime` only has precision up to seconds. So in order to ensure that the waiting job is the newest schema change job, the time interval between two alter jobs should have at least one second.

## Further comments

If this is a relatively large or complex change, kick off the discussion at [dev@doris.apache.org](mailto:dev@doris.apache.org) by explaining why you chose the solution you did and what alternatives you considered, etc...

title: [fix](trash) fix clean trash not working
body:
## Proposed changes

When executing `admin clean trash`,  if the backend daemon clean thread is cleaning trash,  then SQL command will return immediately. But for the backend daemon thread,  it doesn't clean all the trashes,  it clean only the expired trashes.
Also if there's lots of trashes, the daemon clean thread will  busy handling trashes for a long time. 

## Further comments

If this is a relatively large or complex change, kick off the discussion at [dev@doris.apache.org](mailto:dev@doris.apache.org) by explaining why you chose the solution you did and what alternatives you considered, etc...

title: [opt](nereids)push down filter through window
body:
## Proposed changes
select rank() over (partition by A, B) as r, sum(x) over(A, C) as s from T;
      A is a common partition key for all windowExpressions, that is A is intersection of {A,B} and {A, C}
we could push filter A=1 through this window, since  A is a common Partition key:
`select * from (select a, row_number() over (partition by a) from win) T where a=1;`
origin plan:
```
----filter((T.a = 1))
----------PhysicalWindow
------------PhysicalQuickSort
--------------PhysicalProject
------------------PhysicalOlapScan[win]
```

transformed to 
```
----PhysicalWindow
------PhysicalQuickSort
--------PhysicalProject
----------filter((T.a = 1))
------------PhysicalOlapScan[win]
```

But C=1 can not be pushed through window.


Issue Number: close #xxx

<!--Describe your changes.-->

## Further comments

If this is a relatively large or complex change, kick off the discussion at [dev@doris.apache.org](mailto:dev@doris.apache.org) by explaining why you chose the solution you did and what alternatives you considered, etc...

body:

1. The function json_extract can perform different calculations depending on whether the parameter is jsonb or string.
2. Function jsonb_extract new optimizer supports variable parameters
3. If one parameter of the function is null, the result will directly return null.
4. fix non simd int128 overflow

title: update performance tools clickbench,ssb,tpch
body:
## Proposed changes

<!--Describe your changes.-->
update performance tools clickbench,ssb,tpch
The overall goal is to maintain consistency, reduce interpretation costs, and increase user use of performance tools

1. Support for clusters with passwords
2. Unify the way results are counted and collected
3. Change the directory structure, unified naming method, compatible with performance framework, and support user-defined data storage location
4. Split the data production and import links of ckbench and optimize the import for multi-process import
5. Other optimizations

## Further comments

title: [improvemnt](script) support custom lib dir to save custom libs
body:
## Proposed changes

Sometimes, user need to add some custom libs to the cluster, such lzo.jar, orai18n.jar, etc.
In previous, these lib files are places in `fe/lib` or `be/lib`.
But when upgrading cluster, the `lib` dir will be replaced by new `lib` dir, so that all custom libs are lost.

In this PR, I add new dir `custom_lib` for FE and BE, and user can place custom lib files in it.

## Further comments

If this is a relatively large or complex change, kick off the discussion at [dev@doris.apache.org](mailto:dev@doris.apache.org) by explaining why you chose the solution you did and what alternatives you considered, etc...

title: [fix](create tablet) fix backend create tablet timeout
body:
## Proposed changes

pick: #23879

When finishing cloning a tablet, it will write lock all the mutexes of this tablet, then run Tablet.revise_tablet_meta. Revise_tablet_meta is time cost, sometimes even cost 90s. It will cause the tablet's mutexes was locked for a long time.

Daemon::calculate_metrics_thread will get all the tablets's version_count and segement_count every 15 seconds both need aquire the tablet's read lock. So calculate_metrics_thread will be stucked at aquiring the tablet's read lock. Then it will cause tablet manager's shard locks was hold for a long time. Finally, create tablets couldn't acquire the tablet manager's shard locks, and will be timeout.

This PR will get all the tablets and release the tablet manager shard locks, after that, calculate the tablet's version_count and segement_count. It will make the time of occupying the shard lock shortened.

## Further comments

If this is a relatively large or complex change, kick off the discussion at [dev@doris.apache.org](mailto:dev@doris.apache.org) by explaining why you chose the solution you did and what alternatives you considered, etc...

title: [opt](nereids) enable two phase partition topn opt
body:
## Proposed changes

Enable two phase partition topn optimization, instead of original full sort at the second phase. 
E.g, partial plan of tpcds q67 is as following and a full sort after exchange will have performance impact, especially if the window column's ndv is very high and the number of window is huge. 

------PhysicalTopN
--------filter((rk <= 100))
----------PhysicalWindow
------------PhysicalQuickSort
--------------PhysicalDistribute
----------------PhysicalPartitionTopN
------------------PhysicalProject

Under this scenario, the second phase full sort can be transformed to a global PhysicalPartitionTopN and reduce the cost from full sort. The plan will be optimized to the following:

------PhysicalTopN
--------filter((rk <= 100))
----------PhysicalWindow
------------PhysicalPartitionTopN
--------------PhysicalDistribute
----------------PhysicalPartitionTopN
------------------PhysicalProject


<!--Describe your changes.-->

## Further comments

If this is a relatively large or complex change, kick off the discussion at [dev@doris.apache.org](mailto:dev@doris.apache.org) by explaining why you chose the solution you did and what alternatives you considered, etc...

title: [improvement](graceful shutdown) waiting for all query finished when graceful shutdown
body:
## Proposed changes

In some cloud native deployment scenario, BE(especially the Compute Node BE) will be add to cluster and remove from cluster very frequently. User's query will fail if there is a fragment is running on the shutting down BE. Users could use stop_be.sh --grace, then BE will wait all running queries to stop to avoiding running query failure, but if the waiting time exceed the limit, then be will exit directly. During this period, FE will not send any queries to BE and waiting for all running queries to stop


## Further comments

If this is a relatively large or complex change, kick off the discussion at [dev@doris.apache.org](mailto:dev@doris.apache.org) by explaining why you chose the solution you did and what alternatives you considered, etc...
